description.narrative: (USAID Central America Regional): .The activity will reduce greenhouse gas emissions by establishing and applying incentives to reduce deforestation and degradation of forests and other land uses (REDD +); and reduce the vulnerability of human populations to climate change in Central America and the Dominican Republic by integrating geospatial technologies and Earth monitoring observations into development decisions. ..Funding will support Centro Clima, a digital information platform center, to provide demand-driven climate change adaptation information to farmers throughout Central America so they have the tools to mitigate risk and distribute technologies for better decision-making to increase resilience to climate change. Through partnerships with regional organizations, climate change information will be delivered to a variety of end users in thematic information networks, including coffee and agriculture, water, energy, marine coastal biodiversity, and disaster risk reduction....
